subject: Sleep
title: Sleep Position and Brain Drainage
description: A 60-second lesson on Sleep Position and Brain Drainage.

hook.text: Does your sleeping position affect how well your brain cleans itself? Surprisingly, yes.

buildup.text: Researchers tested glymphatic clearance in different sleep positions using imaging in animal models.

discovery.text: Side sleeping, or lateral position, showed the most efficient glymphatic transport and waste removal.

twist.text: Most humans and most mammals naturally prefer sleeping on their side. Evolution may have optimized this.

climax.text: Sleeping on your back or stomach showed less efficient waste clearance in the same models.

punchline.text: Side sleeping might be your brain's preferred rinse cycle.

quiz.question: Which sleep position showed the most efficient brain waste clearance?
